instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 20v 0.04A
threads.message:
Hi. First of all sorry for my non-perfect english.
I have a problem with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mac. It came with a corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C9081</CAPACITOR> and line <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD1_SNS</SIGNAL> was shorted which is a very common issue on that model. After removing shorted cap mac booted and worked stable for 2 weeks, but now it returned back. Not turning on.
   All 4 <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> works good, all LDOs is present, charger switching to 20 volts, but taking just 0.04-0.06 amps
Mac can be detected in DFU mode by apple configurator, but reviving and restoring ends up with an error

But most weird thing is that after i plug in the charger and than plug it off - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is shorted for 2-3 seconds, and then goes back to normal value 0.44 in diod mode. If i plug in charger again - voltage for ppbus is 12.6, whitch is seems to be a bit low. After unplugging the charger ppbus is shorted for 2-3 seconds, and goes back to normal again. I feel very confused and can not understand how is it possible that short circuit can be present and than gone by itself in couple seconds

Any ideas folks?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 20v 0.04A
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

There is no short at all.
Allow few seconds after power is removed, before measure ohm scale, or diode mode.
Let time to discharge remanent voltage stored on the caps.

You probably have SSD problem, if liquid spilled on its area.
DFU ends with error if T2 cannot access SSD.
Check diode mode to ground on all power rails of SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 20v 0.04A
threads.message:
Thanks for greetings!

You were right, there was a short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_X_USBC</SIGNAL>. <CAPACITOR>C3508</CAPACITOR> was removed, short is gone, but nothing changed, still 20v 0.05 amps, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6v. SSD power lines is not shorted. And <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> is missing, S5 is present and stable. Also i found out that <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBT_X_SX</SIGNAL> is missing as well, and it comes out from <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>. Is it possible that <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> is damaged because there was a short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_X_USBC</SIGNAL> which goes directly to <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>? All 4 LDOs (3.3, 1.8, 1.8, and 1.1) is present on all 4 <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck at 20v 0.04A
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_TBT_X_SX</SIGNAL>  should appear only when external device is connected.

If cannot finish DFU correctly, there is something wrong with T2, or SSD.
Be sure no short on any other secondary voltage.
